content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a high-rated recipe for gluten-free brownies on Allrecipes with at least 50 reviews. List the main ingredients and the total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a high-rated gluten-free brownie recipe with at least 50 reviews, I should use the search feature. The search textbox is available at the top of the page.
Action: Type [2]; gluten-free brownies
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search has returned relevant results for gluten-free brownies. I need to find a recipe that is high-rated and has at least 50 reviews. The first few results (labels 9, 10, 11) likely lead to different recipes; I should click on one to check its rating and number of reviews.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This recipe is highly rated (4.9 stars) but only has 24 reviews, which does not meet the requirement of at least 50 reviews. I should go back and try another recipe from the previous search results.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe currently displayed still has only 24 reviews, which is below the required minimum of 50. I need to check the next search result from the previous list for a recipe that meets the review count criteria.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am not currently viewing a recipe page; I seem to be on a category or landing page (possibly for healthy recipes). I need to return to the search results to select another gluten-free brownies recipe that may meet the review requirement.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back at the original gluten-free brownie recipe, which only has 24 reviews—still below the required 50 reviews. I should scroll down the search results page to find another recipe that could meet the criteria.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see further search results or another recipe. The current image seems to be an ad and part of the recipe page. I need to keep scrolling down to reach either the recipe's details or additional search results for gluten-free brownies with more than 50 reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can now see the total time required for the recipe: Prep Time is 20 mins, Cook Time is 25 mins, and Total Time is 45 mins. The section for "Ingredients" is just below. I have not yet found a recipe that meets the review requirement, but I can access the main ingredients by scrolling further down.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see a partial list of the main ingredients for the gluten-free brownies: walnuts (optional), semisweet chocolate chips, unsweetened cocoa powder, tapioca flour, sorghum flour, teff flour, more cocoa powder, xanthan gum, and salt. However, the list appears incomplete (likely more ingredients below). I should scroll further down to capture the full list of main ingredients.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I now see the last main ingredient listed: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. The full list of main ingredients has been gathered from the previous and current screenshots. I have all the required information for the ingredients and total time; however, I need to verify if this recipe has at least 50 reviews, which has not yet been confirmed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still viewing the ingredient list, but not the section that displays the number of reviews for the recipe. To confirm whether this recipe has at least 50 reviews, I need to scroll up further to the top area of the recipe page where ratings and review counts are typically shown.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I can see the summary of prep time (20 mins), cook time (25 mins), and total time (45 mins), but I still do not see the rating or review count. I need to scroll further up to check if this recipe meets the minimum of 50 reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see the image of the brownies, which indicates I am near the top of the recipe page, but I still cannot see the review count or star rating. I need to scroll up a bit more to reach the header area, where such information is usually displayed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe "The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever...Seriously" is highly rated (4.9 stars) but only has 24 reviews, which does not meet the requirement of at least 50 reviews. I need to search for another gluten-free brownies recipe with at least 50 reviews.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still on the same recipe that does not meet the review count requirement (only 24 reviews), and I have not navigated to recipes with more reviews. I need to go back to the search page and try another recipe.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still viewing the same "The Best Gluten Free Brownies Ever...Seriously" recipe with only 24 reviews. I need to find a recipe with at least 50 reviews, which means I should scroll down on the search results or consider adjusting my search.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page still shows the current gluten-free brownie recipe with only 24 reviews. To find a high-rated recipe with at least 50 reviews, I need to go back to the search function and look for other gluten-free brownie options. The search textbox is visible at the top.
Action: Type [2]; gluten-free brownies
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7

content.text:
Observation:note: The web element you're trying to type may not be a textbox, and its tag name is <button>, type is submit. please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Close this dialog window";	[1]: "Continue to Save";	[2]: "Log In";	[3]: "Learn more about MyRecipes";

content:
Thought: A pop-up is blocking the page, prompting to sign up or log in to save recipes. To proceed with searching or navigating the site, I need to close this dialog window. The “Close this dialog window” button is at the top right.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7

[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[11]: "Next Up";	[12]: <button> "Close";

content:
Thought: The pop-up has been closed and I am back to the main page view of the gluten-free brownie recipe. To continue searching for a high-rated gluten-free brownie recipe with at least 50 reviews, I need to access the search feature or find the list of similar recipes. The main menu might help me navigate to baked goods or brownie recipes if a search bar is not visible.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.7

Thought: There is currently no visible search bar or list of recipes, but the main menu button (top left) is available. Clicking the main menu is the best way to find the search tool or access a categories list (e.g., brownies or gluten-free) to locate a more appropriate recipe.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.72
